intro: Manettia barbata, commonly known as the hairy manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers and hairy stems and leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
